page.title: 04GENERAL HOSPITAL, ST.HELIER
page.content: The General Hospital in Gloucester St. has 8 wards, Out Patients,Accident and Emergency Departments, a Pharmacy, Gastroenterology and Radiography Units and a Pathology Laboratory. There were 13,484 admissions in 1984, the average stay being 6 days. By reciprocal agreement, U.K.visitors are treated free of charge whilst Jersey residents are referred to the U.K.for specialist treatment not availabe in the island. Although not part of the National Health Service,the Jersey Group of Hospitals is a U.K.nurses' training school and also takes medical students for 6 weeks practical experience. A new wing currently being built will complete a major redevelopment and will house the Maternity Hospital as well as 6 new wards, 2 operating theatres and a chapel.
